segments.text: I am an eloquent speaker in the classroom . But when I face a stranger outside , I get tongue-tied and nothing comes out .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You should pay close attention to your manner of speaking . Speech is a reflection of personality , you know . You should reflect confidence by speaking in a low voice , loud enough to be heard without being aggressive or overpowering .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I will go out of my way to catch the attention of the interviewer .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Your speech should not call attention to itself , but should reveal your individuality and ability .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ m very shy . I think I might shake in my boots at the moment I meet the interviewer .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You ’ d better overcome your nervousness . it is considered an indication that you lack self-confidence .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Another problem is that I dare not look into their eyes whenever I meet strangers , especially foreigners .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: In China , it is impolite to look into the senior speakers eyes while speaking . But in Western countries it is the opposite . Eye contact gives a strong feeling of sincerity . Looking downwards or sideways shows that you are either insincere or absent-minded .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is there anything else that I should pay attention to in an interview ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . Don ’ t eat onions or garlic before you come . If you do you ’ ll have bad breath .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ ll remember to bring gum with me .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You should never chew gum or smoke during an interview , even if you are allowed to do so .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I remember now . Your advice is very helpful .
segments.speaker: S1
